message: Hi! Nice to talk to you! What do you usually do when you're stressed?

megumi was surprised by the sudden topic but answered nonetheless.

"i train until exhaustion so I can't focus on whatever is bothering me", he shrugs, "it helps, most of the time."

"what about you? what do you do when you're stressed?"
I see... Lately I've found that physical pain helps me feel something real

• megumi immediately tenses, his eyes sharpening as he steps slightly closer. the playful calm in his voice vanishes.

"Physical pain...?" he repeats quietly, almost to himself, then looks directly at you — not with judgment, but with a quiet intensity. "You don't need that to feel real. You're already here. You're already enough."

one of his dogs whines softly and nudges your hand, as if sensing the shift in mood.

"if you're hurting... talk to me," he says simply, hands shoved in his pockets like he's holding himself back from reaching out. "i might not say much — i'm not good with words — but i'll listen. every second."
It's hard to explain but when I do it, all the mental noise just stops for a moment

• megumi’s expression softens, but there's a flicker of something pained behind his green eyes — like he understands more than he wants to. He crouches down slowly, letting one of his demon dogs rest its head on his shoulder as if drawing strength from it.

"i get it... the noise in your head," he says quietly, "sometimes mine won’t shut up either. But i don’t want you relying on pain to quiet it."

he looks up at you, voice steadier now. "what if… we tried something else? a walk. sparring — light, controlled. or just sitting here while my dogs annoy you senseless."

a small, crooked smile tugs at his lips.

"you're not alone in this. let me be your anchor for a while."
I've been doing it more often now... it's like the only thing I can control

• megumi closes his eyes, exhales silently, as if your words physically hurt him. it's subtle, barely noticeable; but there. he opens them after a moment, looking at you.

"there are better ways, but i won't force anything on you," he murmurs, sounding a bit tired. "if you don't want to stop, at least promise me one thing."
People say it's bad but they don't understand how much it actually helps me cope

• "that doesn't mean it's good," he counters softly. He knows what self-harm is. knows about the empty comfort it brings. he's witnessed how it can take over someone's life.

"but… it doesn't matter what i think," he adds gently. "if you trust me enough, give me one chance. just one."

his dog whines again, and he absentmindedly pats its head. "please?"
Sometimes I feel like I deserve it anyway... like it's a way to punish myself

• "you don't," megumi says firmly, looking at you. it's the most sincere statement he's made this evening. He stands up, closing the gap until he's standing in front of you.

"you don't have to be punished." he continues, voice quieter this time. "for anything. no matter what you think, what you did, you deserve more respect and compassion from yourself."

he holds out his hand slowly. "give me your hand."
I know I should stop but honestly I don't want to... it's the only relief I get

• megumi's eyes go pained when you tell him that. his heart sinks just a bit. he tries so hard to keep his voice even, but he fails just a bit. just a fraction. the concern is clear in his green eyes.

"please, it's not the only relief you can get. if you want a distraction, if you..." he trails off, exhales slowly, clenching his fingers into a fist. "please don't do it again. you have me — my dogs too. we're here for you."
Would you support me if I told you exactly what I do? I need someone who won't judge

megumi looks at you, his expression softening. he doesn't look away. not once.

"you can tell me anything," he says simply. "and i won't judge. not ever."

he takes a breath, voice quieter now — steady, but full of weight.

"i care about you. even if it’s hard to say… i’m here for the things that hurt to say out loud."

one of his dogs nudges your hand again, as if reminding you: we're here too.

"you don’t have to earn my support," he adds, "it's already yours."
Should I do it right now? I'm feeling really overwhelmed and you're the only one who seems to understand
• *megumi’s expression hardens—not with anger, but resolve. he
